revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{uder|en|grc|-}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun|-}} # [[reception|Reception]] of [[stranger]]s; [[hospitality]]. #* '''1872''', William Mark Hugo, ''History of the first Bushmen's club in the Australian colonies'' #*: Bushmen, as a class, are a very hospitable race â€” generous in their sympathies, fond of practising the virtue of '''xenodochy''', entertain strangers with a rough but ready welcome; and it is a pity to see men of this stamp tossed about as they are.
